entry.p: This business process helps create the components required for a new refset - these include the member refset, refset spec, comments refset, promotion refset and marked parent refset concepts. The first screen of the BP prompts the owner (person executing the BP) to input a refset name. This text field is required and will form the name of the refset. e.g. inputting "Activities of daily living" will result in "Activities of daily living refset", "Activities of daily living parent refset", etc. to be created. An optional comments text field lets the owner include additional information that the end-user may require. 0 or more file attachments may also be included. By clicking on the next/back buttons the user may navigate between the two screens that make up the refset wizard. The wizard may be exited at any time by clicking on the "Cancel" button. The second screen prompts the user to input an optional requestor. This is a text field since the requestor may be "outside of the system". An editor must be selected from the drop-down list. A deadline and priority must also be selected. When the owner presses the "Finish" button, the BP completes and moves to the editor's inbox. At this point, the editor may view the BP in their inbox. The comments inputted by the owner are visible as the BP message, and selected file attachments may be viewed/saved etc. This information should be saved locally before continuing on with the BP execution. File attachments can be saved by checking the "attachments" checkbox and then right clicking on the file to save. When the editor decides to execute the BP, the BP continues and creates the refset components (concepts, descriptions, relationships), and opens the refset in the refset spec panel. At this point, the refset spec is empty apart from an uncommitted AND and OR. Christine Hill

dlentry.dd: Add OR Clause to RefSet Spec
Add AND Clause to RefSet Spec
